column4: could use some suggestions, not sure if this is the right place. When I type my routers IP, I get my Apache web page. Thoughts?
Dr: local IP.
Dr: From the host computer, not from other computers.
check /etc/hosts
OK
I don't see any mention of my router ip. I just have local 127... and my host ip address.
does the route command return anything that looks wrong?
One are that looks strange id the ff02::ip-6-mcastprefix and a few others
!paste | davdm2010
can you paste the output of route?
xt28:http://paste.ubuntu.com/315270/
that's the hosts file, isn't it?
yes
can you paste the output of route?
let me try. What command would that be?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/315275/
so your router is 192.168.200.1?
yes
maybe you have enabled port forwarding in your router, so it will just send network packets back to your computer?
I do have port forwarding enabled. So, you think it might be in that area?
yes.
Thanks at least that narrows my search and fix.
then again, if you can't access your router's web interface, because it sends everything back to you, your router manufacturer screwed up...
